M: the point above the observer that is directly opposite the nadir on the imaginary sphere against which celestial bodies appear to be projected

an Old Testament book telling the prophecies of Zephaniah which are concerned mainly with the approaching judgment by God upon the sinners of Judah

the 6th letter of the Greek alphabet

type genus of the family Zeidae

dry fruity red wine from California

originally a stronghold captured by David (the 2nd king of the Israelites); above it was built a temple and later the name extended to the whole hill; finally it became a synonym for the city of Jerusalem
